intro: Hartogia pentachotoma, commonly known as the five-branched rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it often grows on rocky outcrops or in dry, sandy soils. Hartogia pentachotoma is adapted to survive in harsh, nutrient-poor environments, showcasing resilience typical of desert flora.
